introduction.technical: Product Designer with 9 years of experience across Web3, fintech, and e-commerce. Engineering graduate who found passion in design, bringing unique perspective on solving complex problems.
introduction.casual: Hey! I'm a product designer who's been building digital products for almost a decade. Started as an engineer, discovered design, and never looked back. I've worked on everything from crypto wallets to e-commerce giants!
introduction.formal: Senior Product Designer with comprehensive experience transforming complex digital products into intuitive experiences across multiple industries and platforms.

introduction.technical: Product Designer specializing in DeFi/Web3 with deep technical foundation. Engineering degree (MIET) enables me to bridge complex blockchain mechanics with intuitive user experiences. Expertise in designing for permissionless protocols, AMMs, and decentralized trading systems.
introduction.casual: I make DeFi actually usable. With my engineering background, I translate complex smart contract interactions into interfaces that traders love.
introduction.formal: Technical Product Designer focused on decentralized finance, bringing engineering rigor to user experience design in blockchain protocols.

introduction.technical: Design leader with proven track record of building design functions from scratch, mentoring teams, and driving measurable business impact through user-centered design strategies.
introduction.casual: I build design teams and ship products that users love. From 0-to-1 startups to enterprise scale, I've led it all.
introduction.formal: Strategic design leader specializing in building high-performing design organizations, establishing scalable processes, and delivering products that drive significant business growth. Proven expertise in team leadership, stakeholder management, and data-driven design decisions.

scenario_b.highlight: First designer, built entire design function

gmx.summary: Joined as the first full-time designer to lead the platform's critical V2 update. Built the entire design function from scratch in a fully anonymous, async DAO environment.
responsibilities: End-to-end design ownership for web and mobile platforms
User research and data analysis (50+ interviews)
Design system architecture and implementation
Cross-functional collaboration with anonymous team
Documentation and process establishment
achievements: 300% increase in unique traders post-V2 launch
60% reduction in order placement errors
35% increase in TVL through improved LP UX
40% uplift in cross-chain transaction volume
Built comprehensive design system from scratch

cere.summary: Led design across diverse Web3 portfolio including NFT Marketplace, decentralized storage, and wallet applications.
responsibilities: Design leadership for multi-product portfolio
Team mentorship and design reviews
Design system development and maintenance
Stakeholder management and strategy alignment
achievements: 150% increase in NFT Marketplace user satisfaction
20% boost in team velocity through design system
25% reduction in design turnaround time
10% increase in user acquisition through gamified flows

p2p.summary: Joined as first designer, grew to lead team of 4. Built non-custodial Solana wallet from scratch in true 0-to-1 experience.
responsibilities: Design leadership across iOS, Android, and Web
User research with crypto natives and newcomers
Team building and mentorship
Product strategy and roadmap planning
achievements: 63% increase in wallet creation conversion
10,000+ active users from zero
150% reduction in negative app reviews
Simplest StableCoin sending on Solana

loyalty.summary: Designed white-label banking applications for financial institutions' loyalty programs, focusing on B2B2C user experiences.
responsibilities: Creating white-label banking and fintech applications
Conducting card-sorting exercises for intuitive navigation
Developing custom UI kit from scratch
Redesigning information architecture based on user research
Collaborating with banks for customization requirements
achievements: 50% improvement in key screen discovery
Enhanced feature discoverability for loyalty programs
Created modular system flexible for multiple bank partners
Redesigned over 50 screens based on user research
Developed architecture serving millions of end-users

wb.summary: Created Russia's largest e-commerce design system while working in the financial department on complex dashboards and CRM systems.
responsibilities: Building comprehensive design system from scratch
Implementing components in Storybook for developers
Designing CRM systems for finance staff
Creating financial dashboards for internal users
Providing UX consulting for iOS and Android payment apps
achievements: 80% component implementation in Storybook
Created the company's most technically advanced design system
Standardized design across multiple departments
Improved internal workflow efficiency through better tools
Established design processes that outlived tenure

gmx_v2.title: GMX V2 Platform Redesign
gmx_v2.desc: Complete transformation addressing user trust crisis

gmx_v2.challenge: GMX V1 was bleeding user trust. The platform had opaque fee structures, a confusing interface that was hostile to both new and experienced traders, and was missing core features like limit orders. User complaints were mounting and growth was stalling.
approach: Conducted 50+ semi-structured user interviews to understand pain points
Analyzed support tickets using LLM aggregation to identify patterns
Created user journey maps highlighting critical friction points
Rapid prototyping with continuous async feedback loops
Close collaboration with engineering on technical constraints
gmx_v2.solution: Complete redesign of the trading interface focusing on transparency and usability. Introduced clear fee breakdowns, intuitive order placement flow, comprehensive position management, and responsive design for all devices. Built everything within 3 months.
results: 300% increase in unique traders within first month
60% reduction in order placement errors
Complete reversal in community sentiment
Platform became the UI standard for DeFi derivatives
gmx_v2.learnings: Working in an anonymous DAO taught me the importance of over-communication and documentation. Success came from deeply understanding user needs and translating complex DeFi mechanics into intuitive interfaces.

gmx_multichain.challenge: Traders needed to manage positions across multiple blockchains (Arbitrum and Avalanche) but were forced to switch networks manually, track positions separately, and manage different gas tokens. This complexity was limiting trading volume and user adoption.
approach: Mapped current multi-chain user journeys to identify friction points
Researched account abstraction and cross-chain messaging protocols
Designed unified 'GMX Account' concept to abstract chain complexity
Created progressive disclosure system for chain-specific details
Tested prototypes with power traders managing multi-chain positions
gmx_multichain.solution: Designed a seamless multi-chain interface where users see a unified portfolio view regardless of underlying chains. Implemented smart routing that automatically selects the best chain for each trade based on liquidity and fees. Chain switching happens invisibly in the background.
results: 40% increase in cross-chain transaction volume
Reduced multi-chain position management time by 65%
Expanded addressable market to users on both chains
Set new standard for multi-chain DeFi UX
gmx_multichain.learnings: The best Web3 UX often means hiding Web3 complexity entirely. Users care about outcomes (their trades), not the underlying technology (which blockchain). Success came from thinking like a trader, not a blockchain engineer.

gmx_system.challenge: GMX had accumulated massive design debt with inconsistent components, no documentation, and developers recreating UI elements from scratch. This was slowing development velocity and creating a fragmented user experience across the platform.
approach: Audited entire platform to catalog existing patterns and inconsistencies
Built token-based architecture using Figma variables and JSON export
Created comprehensive component library with usage guidelines
Developed automated documentation system for developer handoff
Established contribution guidelines for maintaining system integrity
gmx_system.solution: Built a complete design system from the ground up, featuring semantic color tokens, responsive typography scale, and over 200 production-ready components. Integrated directly with development workflow through automated JSON token export and comprehensive Storybook documentation.
results: 30% increase in feature development velocity
40% reduction in UI-related bug reports
90% reduction in design-dev handoff time
Enabled consistent experience across all GMX products
gmx_system.learnings: A design system is only as good as its adoption. By involving developers from day one and automating as much as possible, we created a system that teams actually wanted to use. The key was making the right thing also the easiest thing.

cere_nft.challenge: Cere's NFT marketplace struggled with low artist retention and buyer engagement. Artists found the minting process confusing, buyers couldn't discover relevant content, and the Web3 onboarding created massive drop-off rates for mainstream users.
approach: Conducted interviews with 30+ artists about their minting experience
Analyzed buyer behavior patterns and discovery challenges
Benchmarked against Web2 marketplaces for UX patterns
Designed progressive Web3 onboarding with email/social login
Created artist-first features like batch minting and analytics
cere_nft.solution: Redesigned the entire marketplace with artists at the center. Simplified minting to a 3-step process, added powerful discovery features with AI-powered recommendations, and implemented Web2-style onboarding that gradually introduced Web3 concepts.
results: 150% increase in artist satisfaction scores (CSAT)
200% improvement in buyer engagement metrics
Reduced minting abandonment rate by 45%
10% increase in overall platform user acquisition
cere_nft.learnings: NFT marketplaces succeed when they prioritize creators. By focusing on artist tools and experience first, we created a virtuous cycle where better content attracted more buyers, which attracted more artists.

wildberries.challenge: Russia's largest e-commerce platform had no unified design language across teams. Each department built features independently, resulting in inconsistent experiences, duplicated work, and a fragmented brand presence that confused users.
approach: Audited design patterns across all departments and platforms
Built coalition of stakeholders to champion standardization
Created design system with developer-first documentation
Implemented components directly in Storybook for easy adoption
Established governance model for system maintenance
wildberries.solution: Developed the most comprehensive design system in the company's history, with over 80% of components implemented in production Storybook. Created extensive documentation, usage guidelines, and a contribution model that empowered teams while maintaining consistency.
results: 80% reduction in design inconsistencies across platforms
Saved 100+ hours monthly on component recreation
Improved page load performance through standardized components
System adopted by 6 different departments within 3 months
wildberries.learnings: Building a design system in a large organization is as much about politics as it is about pixels. Success required building consensus, demonstrating value quickly, and making adoption painless for overwhelmed teams.

loyalty.challenge: Banks needed white-label applications for loyalty programs but existing solutions were generic and failed to engage users. Loyalty features were buried, redemption flows were complex, and personalization was non-existent, leading to low program participation.
approach: Conducted card-sorting with 50+ banking customers
Analyzed loyalty program engagement across 10 partner banks
Designed modular architecture for bank customization
Created information hierarchy based on user mental models
Built flexible UI kit supporting multiple brand identities
loyalty.solution: Restructured entire application around user needs rather than bank requirements. Created intuitive navigation that surfaced loyalty benefits prominently, simplified redemption to 2-tap process, and built personalization engine showing relevant offers based on spending patterns.
results: 50% improvement in loyalty feature discovery
Increased program participation by 35% across partner banks
Reduced customer support tickets by 40%
Enabled deployment to 5 new bank partners
loyalty.learnings: B2B2C products require balancing multiple stakeholders' needs. By focusing on end-user experience while building flexibility for business customers, we created a solution that served both audiences effectively.

key_app.challenge: Building a non-custodial crypto wallet that mainstream users could actually use. The Solana ecosystem lacked user-friendly wallets, and existing solutions were too technical for average users.
approach: Competitive analysis of 15+ crypto wallets
User interviews with both crypto natives and newcomers
Iterative prototyping with weekly user testing
Close collaboration with Solana ecosystem partners
Focus on reducing cognitive load at every step
key_app.solution: Designed the simplest StableCoin sending feature on Solana, integrated social login (Google/Apple) for easy onboarding, created educational tooltips without being patronizing, and built trust through transparent security messaging.
results: 63% increase in wallet creation conversion
10,000+ active users from zero
150% reduction in negative app reviews
Featured by Solana Foundation as exemplary UX
key_app.learnings: Simplifying Web3 isn't about hiding complexity—it's about progressive disclosure. Users want to understand what's happening with their money, but only when they're ready for that information.

Design Systems.description: Built comprehensive design systems from scratch at multiple companies, focusing on scalability and developer handoff.
examples: GMX: Token-based system with Figma variables and JSON export
Wildberries: Component library with 80% Storybook coverage
Key App: Multi-platform system for iOS/Android consistency
Design Systems.impact: Reduced design inconsistencies by 90%, accelerated development by 30%

Web3/DeFi UX.description: Specialized in making complex blockchain interactions accessible to mainstream users without sacrificing functionality.
examples: Simplified gas fee explanations with progressive disclosure
One-click trading interfaces hiding complex DeFi mechanics
Social login integration for Web3 onboarding
Web3/DeFi UX.impact: Increased user adoption by 300%, reduced support tickets by 50%

User Research.description: Combining quantitative and qualitative methods to drive design decisions based on real user behavior and needs.
examples: 50+ user interviews for GMX V2 redesign
Behavioral analytics with Hotjar and Mixpanel
User Research.impact: Identified critical UX issues leading to 60% error reduction

Frontend Dev.description: Engineering background enables deep collaboration with developers and ability to prototype complex interactions directly in code.
examples: Built portfolio site with Next.js and custom animations
Prototyped Web3 interactions in React for faster iteration
Implemented design tokens pipeline with automated export
Frontend Dev.impact: Reduced design-dev friction by 50%, enabled rapid prototyping of complex features

Data Analysis.description: Leveraging quantitative data to inform design decisions and measure impact of changes on business metrics.
examples: Built Python scripts to analyze user behavior patterns
Created dashboards tracking design KPIs in Mixpanel
Used cohort analysis to optimize onboarding flows
Data Analysis.impact: Increased conversion rates by 63% through data-driven optimization

Team Leadership.description: Built and led design teams from scratch, establishing processes and culture while maintaining hands-on involvement.
examples: Grew Key App design team from 1 to 4 designers
Established design review process at Cere Network
Mentored junior designers at multiple companies
Team Leadership.impact: Improved team velocity by 20%, maintained high designer retention rates
